meanings.definition: A type of monkey found in North Africa.
meanings.sent1: The magot swung from tree to tree in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: I saw a magot at the zoo during our visit.
meanings.sent3: The magot stole a banana from the picnic basket and ran away!
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a tangled mess, resembling a magot's nest.
meanings.sent5: The magot's curious eyes watched us closely as we passed by.

meanings.definition: A term used to refer to a mischievous or impudent person.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a magot and play pranks on your friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the magot for disrupting the class.
meanings.sent3: The little magot giggled mischievously after hiding his sister's toy.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was a magot, always finding ways to tease her.
meanings.sent5: The magot's sly grin gave away his mischievous intentions.
